The website build was finally fixed and the page is updated now with the right link.

So i was able to resolve both the issues. Below are the details. 

Error 1: 
`Warning  ProvisioningFailed  4m (x382 over 1h)  persistentvolume-controller  Failed to provision volume with StorageClass "bookie-ssd": kubernetes does not have a node in zone "us-east1-b"`

Solution: 
Modify the bookie.yaml file in google kubernetes folder. Comment the `zones: us-east1-b ` as it is hard coded and my cluster was created in different zone  and change ` cluster: us-east` to ` cluster: pulsar-gke`

Error 2: 
`Warning  ProvisioningFailed  3m (x382 over 1h)  persistentvolume-controller  storageclass.storage.k8s.io "ssd" not found`

Solution: 
Modify monitoring.yaml change `storageClassName: ssd` to available storage class.

> The fix LGTM. Can we also add the time string to the log message? We can use regular format like `hh:mm:ss.uuu`

Sure

> Instead of having a configurable option, is there a way to auto-detect the current GC implementation and use the appropriate plugin?

Yes.. I made the change to auto-detect and set appropriate GC based on detection. However, sometimes user might need different implementation and metrics name so, I have still kept pluggable configuration because we also need such mechanism to add custom gc implementation.

@merlimat 
> @JevonQ in Pulsar there are "topics" and "partitioned-topics".
> 
> Partitioned topics are basically just a composition of non-partitioned topics. So, if you have a namespace with, say, 2 bundles and 1 partitioned topic composed of 16 partitions, you should expect that each bundle will contain roughly the same number of partitions (depending on where the hashing falls).
> 
Yes, I understand this.
> Basically, the bundles can be kept splitting in half (if the load is high) until we reach the point where there's just 1 single partition left.

Yes, my question is about this. If the bundle only contains one partition and the partition is still overloaded, is there a way to solve it? Increasing partition does not work for me cause I use key hash as the routing mode while producing the messages.

Ok, I did some digging and here's what I found:
```createIfMissing``` is used when seeing if a Z-Node is already built for a ledger. If a Z-Node does not exist, then a new one will be created (i.e. if ```createIfMissing``` equals ```true```). 

I found that ```PersistentTopicsBase``` will (probably?) create a new ```PersistentTopic``` if there is no partition metadata (```partitionMetadata.partitions == 0 ```) for that particular store.  At this point, I'm not too sure what this means.

My best guess is that if there is no Z-Node for a ledger,  then that means no partitions exists for it either. @sijie 

At this point, I'm not too sure what connection ```createIfMissing``` has with ```partitionMetadata.partitions```.

Edit: Ok, after some more digging. I have found that when ```getPartitionedTopicMetadata``` is called in ```PersistentTopicsBase```, a CompletableFuture will be created. I found that if the value returned is null (i.e. if no corresponding Z-Node exists, ```rc == Code.NONODE.intValue()```), then it indicates that a particular topic is not partitioned. So I think this basically means my inference is right.

@jiazhai @sautran 
org.apache.pulsar.client.kafka.compat.examples.ConsumerExample.java should use pulsar shaded jar offered   [KafkaConsumer](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-client-kafka-compat/pulsar-client-kafka-shaded/pom.xml#L133) class. If you use a runtime environment like IDEA,  you actually Kafka native jar offer class, occurred this error.

solution：
Modify KafkaConsumer to PulsarKafkaConsumer then run this example, no errors occurred.
or Run the examples from command line, like:
```shell
$ vi run.sh
#!/usr/bin/env bash

RELEASE_JAR=`ls ${PULSAR_CODE}/pulsar-client-kafka-compat/pulsar-client-kafka-shaded/target/*.jar 2> /dev/null | grep -v tests | tail -1`
if [ $? == 0 ]; then
    PULSAR_JAR=$RELEASE_JAR
fi

PULSAR_CLASSPATH="$RELEASE_JAR:${PULSAR_CODE}/distribution/server/target/apache-pulsar-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT/conf/log4j2.yaml:${PULSAR_CODE}/pulsar-client-kafka-compat/pulsar-client-kafka-tests/target/pulsar-client-kafka-tests-tests.jar:${PULSAR_CODE}/distribution/server/target/apache-pulsar-2.3.0-SNAPSHOT/lib/*"
OPTS="-cp $PULSAR_CLASSPATH $OPTS"
cd ${PULSAR_CODE}/pulsar-client-kafka-compat/pulsar-client-kafka-tests/target
exec java $OPTS org.apache.pulsar.client.kafka.compat.examples.ProducerExample
```
then run.sh no errors occurred.

If there are no errors in the operation, this is not a bug.

> overall looks good. left bunch of comments.
> 
> Can you also add an integration test and a documentation page for NIFI source and sink?

@jiazhai NiFi is a system based on B/S architecture，users use browsers to develop dataflow using nifi controls.   I add sample doc like:

1. set conf/nifi.properties, like  [configure-site-to-site](http://nifi.apache.org/docs/nifi-docs/html/user-guide.html#configure-site-to-site-server-nifi-instance)

```file
nifi.remote.input.socket.port=10443
```
2. start nifi

```shell
bin/nifi.sh start
```
3. open a web browser and navigate to http://localhost:8080/nifi 

4. sample NiFi receive data from Pulsar:

```file
1 chose Input Port and set Port Name, The Port Name corresponding to pulsar NiFiSink portName.
2 add Processor PutFile and config.
3 start NiFi Flow
```

5.sample NiFi receive data from Pulsar:

```file
1 add Processor GutFile and config.
2 chose Output Port and set Port Name, The Port Name corresponding to pulsar NiFiSource portName.
3 start NiFi Flow
```

What do you think?

> @foreversunyao producers/consumers are not directly connected to ZK.
>

> 

@merlimat Is there any schedule for this?

> In absence of that, I think the best approach is to poll periodically from the client.

@tfhappy hello, I run the code you provided, and have the same problem, but when I set the timeout time to 10s or more, this code works fine. 

the specific reasons are as follows:

```
/**
 * Set the timeout in milliseconds for unacknowledged messages, the timeout needs to be greater than
 * 10 seconds. An Exception is thrown if the given value is less than 10000 (10 seconds).
 * If a successful acknowledgement is not sent within the timeout all the unacknowledged messages are
 * redelivered.
 * @param timeout in milliseconds
 */
void pulsar_consumer_set_unacked_messages_timeout_ms(pulsar_consumer_configuration_t *consumer_configuration,
                                                     const uint64_t milliSeconds);
```

expect to be useful to you.

Another question: 
Should I add a flag?
Custom metadata are there aince bk 4.5, so there should not be a real compatibility issue

@eolivelli I think we should use the `LedgerMetadata.customMetadata` and add few infos there, 
something like :

```json
{
   "application" : "pulsar",
   "component" : "managed-ledger",
   "topic" : "persistent://tenant/ns/my-topic"
}
```

For cursor ledger, we should also have the subscription : 

```json
{
   "application" : "pulsar",
   "component" : "managed-ledger",
   "topic" : "persistent://tenant/ns/my-topic",
   "subscription" : "my-subscription"
}
```

I agree that it's not a problem anymore, since we don't need to maintain the compatibility to rollback a live cluster to BK 4.3 anymore.
Great, it is time to write code now!

ping @merlimat ?

@ambition119 : 

> users use browsers to develop dataflow using nifi controls.

documentation is great! but I think we should also have integration tests to make sure all the code in pulsar repo are well tested in a high quality manner. So everyone is encouraged to have an integration test for a new feature. However if you don't want to add one test in your current PR, please create a github issue for tracking the task of adding integration tests for NIFI connector.

For adding an integration test, you can checkout the tests at https://github.com/apache/pulsar/tree/master/tests

You can check plenty examples of integration tests for different IO connectors. for example, here is the kafka one - https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/tests/integration/src/test/java/org/apache/pulsar/tests/integration/io/KafkaSinkTester.java
run integration tests

Yes some of  my customers have little clusters with Flat. I am going to switch from Kafka to Pulsar, if we are able to run Pulsar on flat it will be very useful, as migrating the ledger manager will be hard and not worth (the cluster would be taken offline)
